Text

The hottest day of the summer so far was drawing to a close and a drowsy silence lay over [the large , square houses of Privet Drive]511-the large , square houses of privet drive . Cars that were usually gleaming stood dusty in [their]512-their drives and lawns that were once emerald green lay parched and yellowing ; the use of hosepipes had been banned due to drought . Deprived of [their]512-their usual car - washing and lawn - mowing pursuits , [the inhabitants of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]513-the inhabitants of privet drive had retreated into the shade of [[their]512-their cool houses]514-their cool houses , windows thrown wide in the hope of tempting in a nonexistent breeze . [The only person left outdoors]515-the only person left outdoors was [a teenage boy who was lying flat on [his]516-a teenage boy who was lying flat on his back in a flower bed outside number four back in a flower bed outside number four]516-a teenage boy who was lying flat on his back in a flower bed outside number four .

[He]516-a teenage boy who was lying flat on his back in a flower bed outside number four was [a skinny , black - haired , bespectacled boy who had the pinched , slightly unhealthy look of someone who has grown a lot in a short space of time]517-a skinny , black - haired , bespectacled boy who had the pinched , slightly unhealthy look of someone who has grown a lot in a short space of time . [His]516-a teenage boy who was lying flat on his back in a flower bed outside number four jeans were torn and dirty , [his]516-a teenage boy who was lying flat on his back in a flower bed outside number four T - shirt baggy and faded , and the soles of [his]516-a teenage boy who was lying flat on his back in a flower bed outside number four trainers were peeling away from the uppers . [Harry Potter]156-harry ’s appearance did not endear [him]156-harry to [the neighbors]518-the neighbors , who were [the sort of people who thought scruffiness ought to be punishable by law]519-the sort of people who thought scruffiness ought to be punishable by law , but as [he]156-harry had hidden [himself]156-harry behind a large hydrangea bush this evening [he]156-harry was quite invisible to [passersby]520-passersby . In fact , the only way [he]156-harry would be spotted was if [[his]156-harry Uncle]521-his uncle [Vernon]157-uncle vernon or [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia stuck [their]522-their heads out of [the living room]523-the living room window and looked straight down into the flower bed below .

On the whole , [Harry]156-harry thought [he]156-harry was to be congratulated on [his]156-harry idea of hiding [here]524-here . [He]156-harry was not , perhaps , very comfortable lying on [the hot , hard earth]525-the hot , hard earth , but on the other hand , [nobody]526-nobody was glaring at [him]156-harry , grinding [their]526-nobody teeth so loudly that [he]156-harry could not hear the news , or shooting nasty questions at [him]156-harry , as had happened every time [he]156-harry had tried sitting down in [the living room]523-the living room and watching television with [[his]156-harry aunt]528-his aunt and [uncle]529-uncle .

Almost as though this thought had fluttered through the open window , [Vernon Dursley]159-vernon dursley , [[Harry]156-harry ’s uncle]530-harry ’s uncle , suddenly spoke . “ Glad to see [the boy]2800-the boy ’s stopped trying to butt in . Where is [he]2800-the boy anyway ? ”[159-vernon dursley]

“ [I]158-aunt petunia do n’t know , ”[158-aunt petunia] said [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia unconcernedly .

[Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon grunted .

“ Watching the news ... ”[157-uncle vernon] [he]157-uncle vernon said scathingly . “ [I]157-uncle vernon ’d like to know what [he]2800-the boy ’s really up to . As if [a normal boy]2801-a normal boy cares what ’s on the news — [Dudley]160-dudley has n’t got a clue what ’s going on , doubt [he]2800-the boy knows who [the Prime Minister]2802-the prime minister is ! Anyway , it ’s not as if there ’d be anything about [his]2800-the boy lot on [our]2803-our news — ”[157-uncle vernon]

“ [Vernon]157-uncle vernon , shh ! ”[158-aunt petunia] said [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia . “ The window ’s open ! ”[158-aunt petunia]

“ Oh — yes — sorry , [dear]2804-dear ... ”[157-uncle vernon]

[The Dursleys]161-the dursleys fell silent . [Harry]156-harry listened to a jingle about [Fruit]162-fruit ’ N Bran breakfast cereal while [he]156-harry watched [Mrs. Figg]163-mrs. figg , [a batty , cat - loving old lady from nearby [Wisteria Walk]2-wisteria walk]531-a batty , cat - loving old lady from nearby wisteria walk , amble slowly past . [She]163-mrs. figg was frowning and muttering to [herself]163-mrs. figg . [Harry]156-harry was very pleased that [he]156-harry was concealed behind the bush ; [Mrs. Figg]163-mrs. figg had recently taken to asking [him]156-harry around for tea whenever [she]163-mrs. figg met [him]156-harry in [the street]532-the street . [She]163-mrs. figg had rounded the corner and vanished from view before [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon ’s voice floated out of the window again .

“ [Dudders]164-dudders out for tea ? ”[157-uncle vernon]

“ At [the Polkisses ’]2805-the polkisses ’ , ”[158-aunt petunia] said [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia fondly . “ [He]164-dudders ’s got so many [little friends]2806-little friends , [he]164-dudders ’s so popular ... ”[158-aunt petunia]

[Harry]156-harry repressed a snort with difficulty . [The Dursleys]161-the dursleys really were astonishingly stupid about [[their]533-their son]534-their son , [Dudley]160-dudley ; [they]533-their had swallowed all [his]160-dudley dim - witted lies about having tea with [a different member of [[his]160-dudley gang]536-his gang]535-a different member of his gang every night of the summer holidays . [Harry]156-harry knew perfectly well that [Dudley]160-dudley had not been to tea anywhere ; [he]156-harry and [[his]156-harry gang]536-his gang spent every evening vandalizing [the play park]538-the play park , smoking on street corners , and throwing stones at [passing cars]539-passing cars and [children]540-children . [Harry]156-harry had seen [them]533-their at [it]541-it during [his]156-harry evening walks around [Little Whinging]206-little whinging ; [he]156-harry had spent most of the holidays wandering [the streets]542-the streets , scavenging newspapers from bins along the way .

The opening notes of the music that heralded the seven o’clock news reached [Harry]156-harry ’s ears and [his]156-harry stomach turned over . Perhaps tonight — after a month of waiting — would be the night —

“ Record numbers of [stranded holidaymakers]2807-stranded holidaymakers fill airports as [the Spanish baggage - handlers]2808-the spanish baggage - handlers ’ strike reaches its second week — ”[156-harry]

“ Give ’em a lifelong siesta , [I]157-uncle vernon would , ”[157-uncle vernon] snarled [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon over the end of the newsreader ’s sentence , but no matter : Outside in the flower bed , [Harry]156-harry ’s stomach seemed to unclench . If anything had happened , it would surely have been the first item on the news ; death and destruction were more important than [stranded holidaymakers]2807-stranded holidaymakers ...

[He]156-harry let out a long , slow breath and stared up at the brilliant blue sky . Every day this summer had been the same : the tension , the expectation , the temporary relief , and then mounting tension again ... and always , growing more insistent all the time , the question of why nothing had happened yet ...

[He]156-harry kept listening , just in case there was some small clue , not recognized for what it really was by [the Muggles]165-muggles — an unexplained disappearance , perhaps , or some strange accident ... but [the baggage - handlers]544-the baggage - handlers ’ strike was followed by news on the drought in [the Southeast]4-the southeast ( “ [I]157-uncle vernon hope [he]156-harry ’s listening next door ! ”[157-uncle vernon] bellowed [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon , “ with [his]156-harry sprinklers on at three in the morning ! ”[157-uncle vernon] ) ; then [a helicopter]545-a helicopter that had almost crashed in [a field in [Surrey]5-surrey]546-a field in surrey , then [a famous actress]547-a famous actress ’s divorce from [[her]547-a famous actress famous husband]548-her famous husband ( “ as if [we]2809-we ’re interested in [their]2809-we sordid affairs , ”[547-a famous actress] sniffed [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia , who had followed the case obsessively in every magazine [she]158-aunt petunia could lay [her]158-aunt petunia bony hands on ) .

[Harry]156-harry closed [his]156-harry eyes against the now blazing evening sky as [the newsreader]549-the newsreader said , “ And finally , [Bungy the budgie]166-bungy the budgie has found a novel way of keeping cool this summer . [Bungy]166-bungy the budgie , who lives at [the Five Feathers in [Barnsley]6-barnsley]2810-the five feathers in barnsley , has learned to water - ski ! [Dorkins]167-dorkins went to find out more ... ”[549-the newsreader]

[Harry]156-harry opened [his]156-harry eyes again . If [they]550-they had reached [water - skiing budgerigars]551-water - skiing budgerigars , there was nothing else worth hearing . [He]156-harry rolled cautiously onto [his]156-harry front and raised [himself]156-harry onto [his]156-harry knees and elbows , preparing to crawl out from under the window .

[He]156-harry had moved about two inches when several things happened in very quick succession .

A loud , echoing crack broke the sleepy silence like a gunshot ; a cat streaked out from under [a parked car]552-a parked car and flew out of sight ; a shriek , a bellowed oath , and the sound of breaking china came from [[the Dursleys]161-the dursleys ’ living room]553-the dursleys ’ living room , and as though [Harry]156-harry had been waiting for this signal , [he]156-harry jumped to [his]156-harry feet , at the same time pulling from the waistband of [his]156-harry jeans a thin wooden wand as if [he]156-harry were unsheathing a sword . But before [he]156-harry could draw [himself]156-harry up to full height , the top of [his]156-harry head collided with [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys ’ open window , and the resultant crash made [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia scream even louder .

[Harry]156-harry felt as if [his]156-harry head had been split in two ; eyes streaming , [he]156-harry swayed , trying to focus on [the street]532-the street and spot the source of the noise , but [he]156-harry had barely staggered upright again when two large purple hands reached through the open window and closed tightly around [his]156-harry throat .

“ Put — it — away ! ”[157-uncle vernon] [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon snarled into [Harry]156-harry ’s ear . “ Now ! Before — [anyone]2811-anyone — sees ! ”[157-uncle vernon]

“ Get — off — [me]156-harry ! ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry gasped ; for a few seconds [they]555-they struggled , [Harry]156-harry pulling at [[his]156-harry uncle]521-his uncle ’s sausage - like fingers with [his]156-harry left hand , [his]156-harry right maintaining a firm grip on [his]156-harry raised wand . Then , as the pain in the top of [Harry]156-harry ’s head gave a particularly nasty throb , [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon yelped and released [Harry]156-harry as though [he]156-harry had received an electric shock — some invisible force seemed to have surged through [[his]157-uncle vernon nephew]557-his nephew , making [him]156-harry impossible to hold .

Panting , [Harry]156-harry fell forward over the hydrangea bush , straightened up , and stared around . There was no sign of what had caused the loud cracking noise , but there were [several faces peering through various nearby windows]558-several faces peering through various nearby windows . [Harry]156-harry stuffed [his]156-harry wand hastily back into [his]156-harry jeans and tried to look innocent .

“ Lovely evening ! ”[157-uncle vernon] shouted [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon , waving at [Mrs. Number Seven]168-mrs. number seven , who was glaring from behind [her]168-mrs. number seven net curtains . “ Did [you]156-harry hear [that car]2812-that car backfire just now ? Gave [Petunia]158-aunt petunia and [me]168-mrs. number seven quite a turn ! ”[168-mrs. number seven]

[He]157-uncle vernon continued to grin in a horrible , manic way until [all the curious neighbors]559-all the curious neighbors had disappeared from [their]559-all the curious neighbors various windows , then the grin became a grimace of rage as [he]157-uncle vernon beckoned [Harry]156-harry back toward [him]157-uncle vernon .

[Harry]156-harry moved a few steps closer , taking care to stop just short of the point at which [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon ’s outstretched hands could resume [their]560-their strangling .

“ What the devil do [you]156-harry mean by it , [boy]2813-boy ? ”[157-uncle vernon] asked [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon in a croaky voice that trembled with fury .

“ What do [I]156-harry mean by what ? ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry coldly . [He]156-harry kept looking left and right up [the street]532-the street , still hoping to see [the person who had made the cracking noise]562-the person who had made the cracking noise .

“ Making a racket like a starting pistol right outside [our]2814-our — ”[158-aunt petunia]

“ [I]156-harry did n’t make that noise , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry firmly .

[Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia ’s thin , horsey face now appeared beside [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon ’s wide , purple one . [She]158-aunt petunia looked livid .

“ Why were [you]156-harry lurking under [our]2814-our window ? ”[158-aunt petunia]

“ Yes — yes , good point , [Petunia]158-aunt petunia ! What were [you]156-harry doing under [our]2814-our window , [boy]2813-boy ? ”[529-uncle]

“ Listening to the news , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry in a resigned voice .

[[His]156-harry aunt]528-his aunt and [uncle]529-uncle exchanged looks of outrage .

“ Listening to the news ! Again ? ”[529-uncle]

“ Well , it changes every day , [you]158-aunt petunia see , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry .

“ Do n’t [you]158-aunt petunia be clever with [me]157-uncle vernon , [boy]2813-boy ! [I]157-uncle vernon want to know what [you]158-aunt petunia ’re really up to — and do n’t give [me]157-uncle vernon any more of this listening to the news tosh ! [You]158-aunt petunia know perfectly well that [your]158-aunt petunia lot ... ”[157-uncle vernon]

“ Careful , [Vernon]157-uncle vernon ! ”[158-aunt petunia] breathed [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia , and [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon lowered [his]157-uncle vernon voice so that [Harry]156-harry could barely hear [him]157-uncle vernon , “ ... that [your]156-harry lot do n’t get on [our]161-the dursleys news ! ”[157-uncle vernon]

“ That ’s all [you]158-aunt petunia know , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry .

[The Dursleys]161-the dursleys goggled at [him]156-harry for a few seconds , then [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia said , “ [You]156-harry ’re [a nasty little liar]2817-a nasty little liar . What are all those — ”[158-aunt petunia] [she]158-aunt petunia too lowered [her]158-aunt petunia voice so that [Harry]156-harry had to lip - read the next word , “ — owls — doing if [they]2818-they ’re not bringing [you]158-aunt petunia news ? ”[158-aunt petunia]

“ Aha ! ”[157-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon in a triumphant whisper . “ Get out of that one , [boy]2813-boy ! As if [we]161-the dursleys did n’t know [you]156-harry get all [your]156-harry news from those pestilential birds ! ”[157-uncle vernon]

[Harry]156-harry hesitated for a moment . It cost [him]156-harry something to tell the truth this time , even though [[his]156-harry aunt]528-his aunt and [uncle]529-uncle could not possibly know how bad [Harry]156-harry felt at admitting it .

“ The owls ... are n’t bringing [me]156-harry news , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry tonelessly .

“ [I]158-aunt petunia do n’t believe it , ”[158-aunt petunia] said [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia at once .

“ No more do [I]157-uncle vernon , ”[157-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon forcefully .

“ [We]161-the dursleys know [you]156-harry ’re up to something funny , ”[158-aunt petunia] said [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia .

“ [We]161-the dursleys ’re not stupid , [you]156-harry know , ”[157-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon .

“ Well , that ’s news to [me]156-harry , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry , [his]156-harry temper rising , and before [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys could call [him]156-harry back , [he]156-harry had wheeled about , crossed [the front lawn]567-the front lawn , stepped over the low garden wall , and was striding off up [the street]532-the street .

[He]156-harry was in trouble now and [he]156-harry knew it . [He]156-harry would have to face [[his]156-harry aunt]528-his aunt and [uncle]529-uncle later and pay the price for [his]156-harry rudeness , but [he]156-harry did not care very much just at the moment ; [he]156-harry had much more pressing matters on [his]156-harry mind .

[Harry]156-harry was sure that the cracking noise had been made by [someone]571-someone Apparating or Disapparating . It was exactly the sound [Dobby]169-dobby the house - elf made when [he]169-dobby vanished into thin air . Was it possible that [Dobby]169-dobby was here in [Privet Drive]1-privet drive ? Could [Dobby]169-dobby be following [him]156-harry right at this very moment ? As this thought occurred [he]156-harry wheeled around and stared back down [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , but [it]572-it appeared to be completely deserted again and [Harry]156-harry was sure that [Dobby]169-dobby did not know how to become invisible ...

[He]156-harry walked on , hardly aware of the route [he]156-harry was taking , for [he]156-harry had pounded [these streets]573-these streets so often lately that [his]156-harry feet carried [him]156-harry to [[his]156-harry favorite haunts]574-his favorite haunts automatically . Every few steps [he]156-harry glanced back over [his]156-harry shoulder . Someone magical had been near [him]156-harry as [he]156-harry lay among [[Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia ’s dying begonias]575-aunt petunia ’s dying begonias , [he]156-harry was sure of it . Why had n’t [they]576-they spoken to [him]156-harry , why had n’t [they]576-they made contact , why were [they]576-they hiding now ?

And then , as [his]156-harry feeling of frustration peaked , [his]156-harry certainty leaked away .

Perhaps it had n’t been a magical sound after all . Perhaps [he]156-harry was so desperate for the tiniest sign of contact from [the world]577-the world to which [he]156-harry belonged that [he]156-harry was simply overreacting to perfectly ordinary noises . Could [he]156-harry be sure it had n’t been the sound of something breaking inside [[a neighbor]578-a neighbor ’s house]579-a neighbor ’s house ?

[Harry]156-harry felt a dull , sinking sensation in [his]156-harry stomach and , before [he]156-harry knew it , the feeling of hopelessness that had plagued [him]156-harry all summer rolled over [him]156-harry once again ...

Tomorrow morning [he]156-harry would be awoken by the alarm at five o’clock so that [he]156-harry could pay the owl that delivered the Daily Prophet — but was there any point in continuing to take it ? [Harry]156-harry merely glanced at the front page before throwing it aside these days ; when [the idiots who ran the paper]580-the idiots who ran the paper finally realized that [Voldemort]170-voldemort was back it would be headline news , and that was the only kind [Harry]156-harry cared about .

If [he]156-harry was lucky , there would also be owls carrying letters from [[his]156-harry best friends]581-his best friends , [Ron]333-ron and [Hermione]172-hermione , though any expectation [he]156-harry had had that [their]581-his best friends letters would bring [him]156-harry news had long since been dashed .

“ [We]581-his best friends ca n’t say much about [you]156-harry - know - what , obviously ... ”[333-ron] “ [We]581-his best friends ’ve been told not to say anything important in case [our]581-his best friends letters go astray ... ”[172-hermione] “ [We]581-his best friends ’re quite busy but [I]172-hermione ca n’t give [you]156-harry details here ... ”[172-hermione] “ There ’s a fair amount going on , [we]581-his best friends ’ll tell [you]156-harry everything when [we]581-his best friends see [you]156-harry ... ”[333-ron]

But when were [they]581-his best friends going to see [him]156-harry ? [Nobody]526-nobody seemed too bothered with a precise date . [Hermione]172-hermione had scribbled , “ [I]172-hermione expect [we]581-his best friends ’ll be seeing [you]156-harry quite soon ”[172-hermione] inside [his]156-harry birthday card , but how soon was soon ? As far as [Harry]156-harry could tell from the vague hints in [their]581-his best friends letters , [Hermione]172-hermione and [Ron]333-ron were in the same place , presumably at [[[Ron]333-ron ’s parents]583-ron ’s parents ’ house]584-ron ’s parents ’ house . [He]156-harry could hardly bear to think of the pair of [them]581-his best friends having fun at [the Burrow]585-the burrow when [he]156-harry was stuck in [Privet Drive]1-privet drive . In fact , [he]156-harry was so angry at [them]581-his best friends that [he]156-harry had thrown both [their]581-his best friends birthday presents of Honeydukes chocolates away unopened , though [he]156-harry had regretted this after eating the wilting salad [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia had provided for dinner that night .

And what were [Ron]333-ron and [Hermione]172-hermione busy with ? Why was n’t [he]156-harry , [Harry]156-harry , busy ? Had n’t [he]156-harry proved [himself]156-harry capable of handling much more than [they]581-his best friends ? Had [they]581-his best friends all forgotten what [he]156-harry had done ? Had n’t it been [he]156-harry who had entered [that graveyard]586-that graveyard and watched [Cedric]173-cedric being murdered and been tied to [that tombstone]587-that tombstone and nearly killed [...]588-... ?

Do n’t think about that , [Harry]156-harry told [himself]156-harry sternly for the hundredth time that summer . It was bad enough that [he]156-harry kept revisiting [the graveyard]589-the graveyard in [his]156-harry nightmares , without dwelling on it in [his]156-harry waking moments too .

[He]156-harry turned a corner into [Magnolia Crescent]7-magnolia crescent ; halfway along [he]156-harry passed [the narrow alleyway down the side of [a garage]591-a garage where [he]156-harry had first clapped eyes on [[his]156-harry godfather]592-his godfather]590-the narrow alleyway down the side of a garage where he had first clapped eyes on his godfather . [Sirius]174-sirius , at least , seemed to understand how [Harry]156-harry was feeling ; admittedly [his]174-sirius letters were just as empty of proper news as [Ron]333-ron and [Hermione]172-hermione ’s , but at least they contained words of caution and consolation instead of tantalizing hints :

“ [I]174-sirius know this must be frustrating for [you]156-harry ... ”[174-sirius] “ Keep [your]156-harry nose clean and everything will be okay ... ”[174-sirius] “ Be careful and do n’t do anything rash ... ”[174-sirius]

Well , thought [Harry]156-harry , as [he]156-harry crossed [Magnolia Crescent]7-magnolia crescent , turned into [Magnolia Road]8-magnolia road , and headed toward [the darkening play park]593-the darkening play park , [he]156-harry had ( by and large ) done as [Sirius]174-sirius advised ; [he]156-harry had at least resisted the temptation to tie [his]156-harry trunk to [his]156-harry broomstick and set off for [the Burrow]585-the burrow by [himself]156-harry . In fact [Harry]156-harry thought [his]156-harry behavior had been very good considering how frustrated and angry [he]156-harry felt at being stuck in [Privet Drive]1-privet drive this long , reduced to hiding in flower beds in the hope of hearing something that might point to what [Lord Voldemort]170-voldemort was doing . Nevertheless , it was quite galling to be told not to be rash by [a man who had served twelve years in [the wizard prison]596-the wizard prison]595-a man who had served twelve years in the wizard prison , [Azkaban]14-azkaban , escaped , attempted to commit the murder [he]156-harry had been convicted for in the first place , then gone on the run with [a stolen hippogriff]597-a stolen hippogriff ...

[Harry]156-harry vaulted over [the locked park]598-the locked park gate and set off across the parched grass . [The park]599-the park was as empty as [the surrounding streets]600-the surrounding streets . When [he]156-harry reached [the swings]601-the swings [he]156-harry sank onto the only one that [Dudley]160-dudley and [[his]160-dudley friends]602-his friends had not yet managed to break , coiled one arm around the chain , and stared moodily at the ground . [He]156-harry would not be able to hide in [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys ’ flower bed again . Tomorrow [he]156-harry would have to think of some fresh way of listening to the news . In the meantime , [he]156-harry had nothing to look forward to but another restless , disturbed night , because even when [he]156-harry escaped nightmares about [Cedric]173-cedric [he]156-harry had unsettling dreams about [long dark corridors]603-long dark corridors , all finishing in dead ends and locked doors , which [he]156-harry supposed had something to do with the trapped feeling [he]156-harry had when [he]156-harry was awake . Often the old scar on [his]156-harry forehead prickled uncomfortably , but [he]156-harry did not fool [himself]156-harry that [Ron]333-ron or [Hermione]172-hermione or [Sirius]174-sirius would find that very interesting anymore ... In the past [his]156-harry scar hurting had warned that [Voldemort]170-voldemort was getting stronger again , but now that [Voldemort]170-voldemort was back [they]604-they would probably remind [him]156-harry that its regular irritation was only to be expected ... Nothing to worry about ... old news ...

The injustice of it all welled up inside [him]156-harry so that [he]156-harry wanted to yell with fury . If it had n’t been for [him]156-harry , [nobody]526-nobody would even have known [Voldemort]170-voldemort was back ! And [his]156-harry reward was to be stuck in Little Whinging for four solid weeks , completely cut off from [the magical world]606-the magical world , reduced to squatting among dying begonias so that [he]156-harry could hear about water - skiing budgerigars ! How could [Dumbledore]176-dumbledore have forgotten [him]156-harry so easily ? Why had [Ron]333-ron and [Hermione]172-hermione got together without inviting [him]156-harry along too ? How much longer was [he]156-harry supposed to endure [Sirius]174-sirius telling [him]156-harry to sit tight and be [a good boy]607-a good boy ; or resist the temptation to write to [the stupid Daily Prophet]608-the stupid daily prophet and point out that [Voldemort]170-voldemort had returned ? These furious thoughts whirled around in [Harry]156-harry ’s head , and [his]156-harry insides writhed with anger as a sultry , velvety night fell around [him]156-harry , the air full of the smell of warm , dry grass and the only sound that of the low grumble of traffic on [the road]609-the road beyond [the park]599-the park railings .

[He]156-harry did not know how long [he]156-harry had sat on the swing before the sound of voices interrupted [his]156-harry musings and [he]156-harry looked up . The streetlamps from [the surrounding roads]611-the surrounding roads were casting a misty glow strong enough to silhouette [a group of people]612-a group of people making [their]612-a group of people way across [the park]599-the park . [One of [them]612-a group of people]614-one of them was singing a loud , crude song . [The others]615-the others were laughing . A soft ticking noise came from [several expensive racing bikes]616-several expensive racing bikes that [they]615-the others were wheeling along .

[Harry]156-harry knew who [those people]617-those people were . [The figure in front]618-the figure in front was unmistakably [[his]156-harry cousin]619-his cousin , [Dudley Dursley]160-dudley , wending [his]160-dudley way [home]620-home , accompanied by [[his]160-dudley faithful gang]621-his faithful gang .

[Dudley]160-dudley was as vast as ever , but a year ’s hard dieting and the discovery of a new talent had wrought quite a change in [his]160-dudley physique . As [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon delightedly told [anyone who would listen]622-anyone who would listen , [Dudley]160-dudley had recently become [the Junior Heavyweight Inter - School Boxing Champion of the Southeast]623-the junior heavyweight inter - school boxing champion of the southeast . “ The noble sport , ”[157-uncle vernon] as [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon called it , had made [Dudley]160-dudley even more formidable than [he]160-dudley had seemed to [Harry]156-harry in the primary school days when [he]160-dudley had served as [Dudley]160-dudley ’s first punching bag . [Harry]156-harry was not remotely afraid of [[his]156-harry cousin]619-his cousin anymore but [he]156-harry still did n’t think that [Dudley]160-dudley learning to punch harder and more accurately was cause for celebration . [Neighborhood children all around]625-neighborhood children all around were terrified of [him]160-dudley — even more terrified than [they]625-neighborhood children all around were of “ [that Potter boy]2820-that potter boy , ”[625-neighborhood children all around] who , [they]625-neighborhood children all around had been warned , was [a hardened hooligan who attended [[St. Brutus]177-st. brutus ’s Secure Center for Incurably Criminal Boys]9-st. brutus ’s secure center for incurably criminal boys]626-a hardened hooligan who attended st. brutus ’s secure center for incurably criminal boys .

[Harry]156-harry watched [the dark figures crossing the grass]627-the dark figures crossing the grass and wondered whom [they]627-the dark figures crossing the grass had been beating up tonight . Look round , [Harry]156-harry found [himself]156-harry thinking as [he]156-harry watched [them]627-the dark figures crossing the grass . Come on ... look round ... [I]0-i ’m sitting here all alone ... Come and have a go ...

If [[Dudley]160-dudley ’s friends]628-dudley ’s friends saw [him]160-dudley sitting here , [they]628-dudley ’s friends would be sure to make a beeline for [him]160-dudley , and what would [Dudley]160-dudley do then ? [He]160-dudley would n’t want to lose face in front of [the gang]629-the gang , but [he]160-dudley ’d be terrified of provoking [Harry]156-harry ... It would be really fun to watch [Dudley]160-dudley ’s dilemma ; to taunt [him]160-dudley , watch [him]160-dudley , with [him]160-dudley powerless to respond ... and if any of [the others]615-the others tried hitting [Harry]156-harry , [Harry]156-harry was ready — [he]156-harry had [his]156-harry wand ... let [them]615-the others try ... [He]156-harry ’d love to vent some of [his]156-harry frustration on [the boys who had once made [his]156-harry life hell]631-the boys who had once made his life hell —

But [they]615-the others did not turn around , [they]615-the others did not see [him]156-harry , [they]615-the others were almost at the railings . [Harry]156-harry mastered the impulse to call after [them]615-the others ... Seeking a fight was not a smart move ... [He]156-harry must not use magic ... [He]156-harry would be risking expulsion again ...

[Dudley]160-dudley ’s gang ’s voices died ; [they]615-the others were out of sight , heading along [Magnolia Road]8-magnolia road .

There [you]632-you go , [Sirius]174-sirius , [Harry]156-harry thought dully . Nothing rash . Kept [my]0-i nose clean . Exactly the opposite of what [you]632-you ’d have done ...

[He]156-harry got to [his]156-harry feet and stretched . [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon seemed to feel that whenever [Dudley]160-dudley turned up was the right time to be [home]620-home , and anytime after that was much too late . [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon had threatened to lock [Harry]156-harry in [the shed]634-the shed if [he]156-harry came [home]620-home after [Dudley]160-dudley again , so , stifling a yawn , still scowling , [Harry]156-harry set off toward [the park gate]636-the park gate .

[Magnolia Road]8-magnolia road , like [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , was full of [large , square houses with perfectly manicured lawns]637-large , square houses with perfectly manicured lawns , all owned by [large , square owners who drove very clean cars similar to [[Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon ’s]639-uncle vernon ’s]638-large , square owners who drove very clean cars similar to uncle vernon ’s . [Harry]156-harry preferred Little Whinging by night , when the curtained windows made patches of jewel - bright colors in the darkness and [he]156-harry ran no danger of hearing disapproving mutters about [his]156-harry “ delinquent ”[156-harry] appearance when [he]156-harry passed [the householders]640-the householders . [He]156-harry walked quickly , so that halfway along [Magnolia Road]8-magnolia road [[Dudley]160-dudley ’s gang]641-dudley ’s gang came into view again ; [they]641-dudley ’s gang were saying [their]641-dudley ’s gang farewells at the entrance to [Magnolia Crescent]7-magnolia crescent . [Harry]156-harry stepped into the shadow of a large lilac tree and waited .

“ ... squealed like a pig , did n’t [he]156-harry ? ”[178-malcolm] [Malcolm]178-malcolm was saying , to guffaws from [the others]615-the others .

“ Nice right hook , [Big D]182-big d , ”[179-piers] said [Piers]179-piers .

“ [Bye Dud]181-bye dud ! ”[160-dudley]

“ See [ya]160-dudley , [Big D]182-big d ! ”[156-harry]

[Harry]156-harry waited for [the rest of [the gang]629-the gang]643-the rest of the gang to move on before setting off again . “ Hey , [Big D]182-big d ! ”[160-dudley]

“ Oh , ”[160-dudley] [he]160-dudley grunted . “ [It]182-big d ’s [you]182-big d . ”[160-dudley]

“ How long have [you]160-dudley been ‘ Big D ’ then ? ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry .

“ [I]160-dudley said , SHUT [IT]2823-it ! ”[160-dudley] said [Dudley]160-dudley , whose ham - like hands had curled into fists .

[Dudley]160-dudley said nothing . The effort of keeping [himself]160-dudley from hitting [Harry]156-harry seemed to be demanding all [his]160-dudley self - control .

“ So who ’ve [you]160-dudley been beating up tonight ? ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry asked , [his]156-harry grin fading . “ [Another ten - year - old]2826-another ten - year - old ? [I]156-harry know [you]160-dudley did [Mark Evans]185-mark evans two nights ago — ”[156-harry]

“ [He]185-mark evans was asking for it , ”[160-dudley] snarled [Dudley]160-dudley .

“ Oh yeah ? ”[156-harry]

“ [He]185-mark evans cheeked [me]156-harry . ”[156-harry]

“ Yeah ? Did [he]185-mark evans say [you]160-dudley look like a pig that ’s been taught to walk on its hind legs ? ’Cause that ’s not cheek , [Dud]160-dudley , that ’s true ... ”[156-harry]

A muscle was twitching in [Dudley]160-dudley ’s jaw . It gave [Harry]156-harry enormous satisfaction to know how furious [he]156-harry was making [Dudley]160-dudley ; [he]156-harry felt as though [he]156-harry was siphoning off [his]156-harry own frustration into [[his]156-harry cousin]619-his cousin , the only outlet [he]156-harry had .

[They]647-they turned right down [the narrow alleyway where [Harry]156-harry had first seen [Sirius]174-sirius and which formed a shortcut between [Magnolia Crescent]7-magnolia crescent and [Wisteria Walk]2-wisteria walk]648-the narrow alleyway where harry had first seen sirius and which formed a shortcut between magnolia crescent and wisteria walk . [It]648-the narrow alleyway where harry had first seen sirius and which formed a shortcut between magnolia crescent and wisteria walk was empty and much darker than [the streets]542-the streets [it]648-the narrow alleyway where harry had first seen sirius and which formed a shortcut between magnolia crescent and wisteria walk linked because there were no streetlamps . [Their]647-they footsteps were muffled between garage walls on one side and a high fence on the other .

“ Think [you]156-harry ’re [a big man carrying that thing]2827-a big man carrying that thing , do n’t [you]156-harry ? ”[160-dudley] [Dudley]160-dudley said after a few seconds .

“ What thing ? ”[160-dudley]

“ That — that thing [you]160-dudley ’re hiding . ”[160-dudley]

[Harry]156-harry grinned again .

“ Not as stupid as [you]160-dudley look , are [you]160-dudley , [Dud]160-dudley ? But [I]156-harry s’pose if [you]160-dudley were , [you]160-dudley would n’t be able to walk and talk at the same time ... ”[156-harry]

[Harry]156-harry pulled out [his]156-harry wand . [He]156-harry saw [Dudley]160-dudley look sideways at it .

[Dudley]160-dudley gave an odd , shuddering gasp , as though [he]160-dudley had been doused in icy water .

Something had happened to the night . The distant grumble of cars and the whisper of trees had gone . The balmy evening was suddenly piercingly , bitingly cold . [They]654-they were surrounded by total , impenetrable , silent darkness , as though some giant hand had dropped a thick , icy mantle over [the entire alleyway]655-the entire alleyway , blinding [them]654-they .

For a split second [Harry]156-harry thought [he]156-harry had done magic without meaning to , despite the fact that [he]156-harry ’d been resisting as hard as [he]156-harry could — then [his]156-harry reason caught up with [his]156-harry senses — [he]156-harry did n’t have the power to turn off the stars . [He]156-harry turned [his]156-harry head this way and that , trying to see something , but the darkness pressed on [his]156-harry eyes like a weightless veil .

[Harry]156-harry stood stock - still , turning [his]156-harry sightless eyes left and right . [Harry]156-harry snatched it up , scrambled to [his]156-harry feet , and turned around .

[His]156-harry stomach turned over .

[A towering , hooded figure]659-a towering , hooded figure was gliding smoothly toward [him]156-harry , hovering over the ground , no feet or face visible beneath its robes , sucking on the night as it came .

“ Expecto Patronum ! ”[156-harry]

A silvery wisp of vapor shot from the tip of the wand and the dementor slowed , but the spell had n’t worked properly ; tripping over [his]156-harry feet , [Harry]156-harry retreated farther as the dementor bore down upon [him]156-harry , panic fogging [his]156-harry brain — concentrate —

[His]156-harry voice sounded dim and distant ... Another wisp of silver smoke , feebler than the last , drifted from the wand — [he]156-harry could n’t do it anymore , [he]156-harry could n’t work the spell —

[He]156-harry was never going to see [Ron]333-ron and [Hermione]172-hermione again —

“ And what the ruddy hell are [dementors]2842-dementors ? ”[157-uncle vernon]

“ Let go of it , [Petunia]158-aunt petunia ! ”[157-uncle vernon] roared [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon . “ Do n’t touch it , it could be dangerous ! ”[157-uncle vernon]

[Mrs. Petunia Dursley]211-mrs. petunia dursley , [The Kitchen]694-the kitchen , [Number Four]21-number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive — ”[158-aunt petunia]

[She]158-aunt petunia caught [her]158-aunt petunia breath , horrified . The red envelope had begun to smoke .

“ Open it ! ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry urged [her]158-aunt petunia . “ Get it over with ! It ’ll happen anyway — ”[156-harry]

“ No — ”[158-aunt petunia]

[Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia ’s hand was trembling . [She]158-aunt petunia looked wildly around [the kitchen]694-the kitchen as though looking for an escape route , but too late — the envelope burst into flames . [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia screamed and dropped [it]764-it .

An awful voice filled [the kitchen]694-the kitchen , echoing in the confined space , issuing from the burning letter on the table .

“ REMEMBER [MY]158-aunt petunia LAST , [PETUNIA]158-aunt petunia . ”[158-aunt petunia]

[Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia looked as though [she]158-aunt petunia might faint . [She]158-aunt petunia sank into the chair beside [Dudley]160-dudley , [her]158-aunt petunia face in [her]158-aunt petunia hands . The remains of the envelope smoldered into ash in the silence .

“ What is this ? ”[157-uncle vernon] [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon said hoarsely . “ What — [I]157-uncle vernon do n’t — [Petunia]158-aunt petunia ? ”[157-uncle vernon]

[Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia said nothing . [Dudley]160-dudley was staring stupidly at [[his]160-dudley mother]750-his mother , [his]160-dudley mouth hanging open . The silence spiraled horribly . [Harry]156-harry was watching [[his]156-harry aunt]528-his aunt , utterly bewildered , [his]156-harry head throbbing fit to burst .

“ [Petunia]158-aunt petunia , [dear]2804-dear ? ”[157-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon timidly . “ [P - Petunia]212-p - petunia ? ”[157-uncle vernon]

[Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon was deflating like an old tire .

“ [YOU]156-harry HEARD [[YOUR]156-harry AUNT]2968-your aunt , NOW GET TO [BED]22-bed ! ”[156-harry]

[I]0-i ’ve just been attacked by [dementors]2842-dementors and [I]0-i might be expelled from [Hogwarts]13-hogwarts . [I]0-i want to know what ’s going on and when [I]0-i ’m going to get out of [here]524-here .

[Harry]156-harry copied these words onto three separate pieces of parchment the moment [he]156-harry reached the desk in [[his]156-harry dark bedroom]738-his dark bedroom . [He]156-harry addressed the first to [Sirius]174-sirius , [the second]771-the second to [Ron]333-ron , and the third to [Hermione]172-hermione . [His]156-harry owl , [Hedwig]213-hedwig , was off hunting ; [her]213-hedwig cage stood empty on the desk . [Harry]156-harry paced [the bedroom]772-the bedroom waiting for [her]213-hedwig to come back , [his]156-harry head pounding , [his]156-harry brain too busy for sleep even though [his]156-harry eyes stung and itched with tiredness . [His]156-harry back ached from carrying [Dudley]160-dudley [home]620-home , and the two lumps on [his]156-harry head where the window and [Dudley]160-dudley had hit [him]156-harry were throbbing painfully .

Up and down [he]156-harry paced , consumed with anger and frustration , grinding [his]156-harry teeth and clenching [his]156-harry fists , casting angry looks out at the empty , star - strewn sky every time [he]156-harry passed the window . [Dementors]189-dementors sent to get [him]156-harry , [Mrs. Figg]163-mrs. figg and [Mundungus Fletcher]190-mundungus tailing [him]156-harry in secret , then suspension from [Hogwarts]13-hogwarts and a hearing at [the Ministry of Magic]2890-the ministry of magic — and still [no one]775-no one was telling [him]156-harry what was going on .

And what , what , had [that Howler]2966-that howler been about ? Whose voice had echoed so horribly , so menacingly , through [the kitchen]694-the kitchen ?

Why was [he]156-harry still trapped [here]524-here without information ? Why was [everyone]779-everyone treating [him]156-harry like [some naughty kid]780-some naughty kid ? Do n’t do any more magic , stay in [the house]2870-the house ...

[He]156-harry kicked [his]156-harry school trunk as [he]156-harry passed [it]2870-the house , but far from relieving [his]156-harry anger [he]156-harry felt worse , as [he]156-harry now had a sharp pain in [his]156-harry toe to deal with in addition to the pain in the rest of [his]156-harry body .

“ About time ! ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry snarled , as [she]213-hedwig landed lightly on top of [her]213-hedwig cage . “ [You]213-hedwig can put that down , [I]213-hedwig ’ve got work for [you]213-hedwig ! ”[213-hedwig]

Keep pecking [them]2969-them till [they]2969-them ’ve written decent - length answers if [you]156-harry ’ve got to . Understand ? ”[156-harry]

[Hedwig]213-hedwig gave a muffled hooting noise , beak still full of frog .

“ Get going , then , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry .

[She]213-hedwig took off immediately . The moment [she]213-hedwig ’d gone , [Harry]156-harry threw [himself]156-harry down onto [his]156-harry bed without undressing and stared at the dark ceiling . In addition to every other miserable feeling , [he]156-harry now felt guilty that [he]156-harry ’d been irritable with [Hedwig]213-hedwig ; [she]213-hedwig was the only friend [he]156-harry had at number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive . [They]782-they were bound to write back quickly ; [they]782-they could n’t possibly ignore a dementor attack . [He]156-harry ’d probably wake up tomorrow to three fat letters full of sympathy and plans for [his]156-harry immediate removal to [the Burrow]24-the burrow . And with that comforting idea , sleep rolled over [him]156-harry , stifling all further thought .

But [Hedwig]213-hedwig did n’t return next morning . [Harry]156-harry spent the day in [[his]156-harry bedroom]783-his bedroom , leaving it only to go to [the bathroom]784-the bathroom . Three times that day [Aunt Petunia]158-aunt petunia shoved food into [[his]156-harry room]785-his room through the cat flap [Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon had installed three summers ago . Every time [Harry]156-harry heard [her]213-hedwig approaching [he]156-harry tried to question [her]213-hedwig about [the Howler]786-the howler , but [he]156-harry might as well have interrogated the doorknob for all the answers [he]156-harry got . Otherwise [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys kept well clear of [[his]156-harry bedroom]783-his bedroom . [Harry]156-harry could n’t see the point of forcing [[his]156-harry company]788-his company on [them]789-them ; another row would achieve nothing except perhaps making [him]156-harry so angry [he]156-harry ’d perform more illegal magic .

So it went on for three whole days . [Harry]156-harry was filled alternately with restless energy that made [him]156-harry unable to settle to anything , during which [he]156-harry paced [[his]156-harry bedroom]783-his bedroom again , furious at [the whole lot of [them]789-them]791-the whole lot of them for leaving [him]156-harry to stew in this mess , and with a lethargy so complete that [he]156-harry could lie on [his]156-harry bed for an hour at a time , staring dazedly into space , aching with dread at the thought of the Ministry hearing .

What if [they]789-them ruled against [him]156-harry ? What if [he]156-harry was expelled and [his]156-harry wand was snapped in half ? What would [he]156-harry do , where would [he]156-harry go ? [He]156-harry could not return to living full - time with [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys , not now that [he]156-harry knew [the other world]792-the other world , [the one to which [he]156-harry really belonged ...]793-the one to which he really belonged ... Would [he]156-harry be allowed to live [there]796-there alone , given that [he]156-harry was still underage ? Whenever this thought occurred , [Harry]156-harry invariably slid off [his]156-harry bed and began pacing again .

On the fourth night after [Hedwig]213-hedwig ’s departure [Harry]156-harry was lying in one of [his]156-harry apathetic phases , staring at the ceiling , [his]156-harry exhausted mind quite blank , when [[his]156-harry uncle]521-his uncle entered [[his]156-harry bedroom]783-his bedroom . [Harry]156-harry had no particular feeling about [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys leaving . It made no difference to [him]156-harry whether [they]804-they were in [the house]2870-the house or not . [The empty house]807-the empty house creaked around [him]156-harry . The pipes gurgled . [Harry]156-harry lay there in a kind of stupor , thinking of nothing , suspended in misery .

[Harry]156-harry lowered [his]156-harry wand slightly but did not relax [his]156-harry grip on it , nor did [he]156-harry move . [He]156-harry had very good reason to be suspicious . “ Mount [your]156-harry brooms , that ’s the first signal ! ”[221-lupin] said [Lupin]221-lupin sharply , pointing into the sky .

Far , far above [them]871-them , a shower of bright red sparks had flared among the stars . [Harry]156-harry recognized them at once as wand sparks . [He]156-harry swung [his]156-harry right leg over [his]156-harry Firebolt , gripped its handle tightly , and felt it vibrating very slightly , as though it was as keen as [he]156-harry was to be up in the air once more .

“ Second signal , let ’s go ! ”[221-lupin] said [Lupin]221-lupin loudly , as more sparks , green this time , exploded high above [them]871-them .

[Harry]156-harry kicked off hard from the ground . The cool night air rushed through [his]156-harry hair as [the neat square gardens of Privet Drive]872-the neat square gardens of privet drive fell away , shrinking rapidly into a patchwork of dark greens and blacks , and every thought of the Ministry hearing was swept from [his]156-harry mind as though the rush of air had blown it out of [his]156-harry head . [He]156-harry felt as though [his]156-harry heart was going to explode with pleasure ; [he]156-harry was flying again , flying away from [Privet Drive]1-privet drive as [he]156-harry ’d been fantasizing about all summer , [he]156-harry was going [home]620-home ... For a few glorious moments , all [his]156-harry problems seemed to recede into nothing , insignificant in the vast , starry sky .

“ Hard left , hard left , there ’s a Muggle looking up ! ”[218-moody] shouted [Moody]218-moody from behind [him]156-harry . [Tonks]225-tonks swerved and [Harry]156-harry followed [her]225-tonks , watching [his]156-harry trunk swinging wildly beneath [her]225-tonks broom . “ [We]874-we need more height ... Give it another quarter of a mile ! ”[156-harry]

[Harry]156-harry ’s eyes watered in the chill as [they]874-we soared upward ; [he]156-harry could see nothing below now but tiny pinpricks of light that were car headlights and streetlamps . Two of those tiny lights might belong to [[Uncle Vernon]157-uncle vernon ’s car]875-uncle vernon ’s car ... [The Dursleys]161-the dursleys would be heading back to [[their]874-we empty house]876-their empty house right now , full of rage about the nonexistent lawn competition ... and [Harry]156-harry laughed aloud at the thought , though [his]156-harry voice was drowned by the flapping of [the others]615-the others ’ robes , the creaking of the harness holding [his]156-harry trunk and the cage , the whoosh of the wind in [their]874-we ears as [they]874-we sped through the air . [He]156-harry had not felt this alive in a month , or this happy ...

“ Bearing south ! ”[218-moody] shouted [Mad - Eye]218-moody . “ [Town]3029-town ahead ! ”[218-moody]

[They]874-we soared right , so that [they]874-we did not pass directly over the glittering spiderweb of lights below .

“ [Bear]238-bear southeast and keep climbing , there ’s some low cloud ahead [we]874-we can lose [ourselves]874-we in ! ”[218-moody] called [Moody]218-moody .

“ [We]874-we ’re not going through clouds ! ”[225-tonks] shouted [Tonks]225-tonks angrily . “ [We]874-we ’ll get soaked , [Mad - Eye]218-moody ! ”[225-tonks]

[Harry]156-harry was relieved to hear [her]878-her say this ; [his]156-harry hands were growing numb on the Firebolt ’s handle . [He]156-harry wished [he]156-harry had thought to put on a coat ; [he]156-harry was starting to shiver .

[They]874-we altered [their]874-we course every now and then according to [Mad - Eye]218-moody ’s instructions . [Harry]156-harry ’s eyes were screwed up against the rush of icy wind that was starting to make [his]156-harry ears ache . [He]156-harry could remember being this cold on a broom only once before , during the Quidditch match against [Hufflepuff]239-hufflepuff in [his]156-harry third year , which had taken place in a storm . [The guard around [him]156-harry]879-the guard around him was circling continuously like giant birds of prey . [Harry]156-harry lost track of time . [He]156-harry wondered how long [they]874-we had been flying ; it felt like an hour at least .

“ Turning southwest ! ”[218-moody] yelled [Moody]218-moody . “ [We]874-we want to avoid [the motorway]3030-the motorway ! ”[218-moody]

[Harry]156-harry was now so chilled that [he]156-harry thought longingly for a moment of the snug , dry interiors of [the cars streaming along below]880-the cars streaming along below , then , even more longingly , of traveling by Floo powder ; it might be uncomfortable to spin around in fireplaces but it was at least warm in the flames ... [Kingsley Shacklebolt]226-kingsley swooped around [him]156-harry , bald pate and earring gleaming slightly in the moonlight ... Now [Emmeline Vance]229-emmeline vance was on [his]156-harry right , [her]229-emmeline vance wand out , [her]229-emmeline vance head turning left and right ... then [she]229-emmeline vance too swooped over [him]156-harry , to be replaced by [Sturgis Podmore]230-sturgis podmore ...

“ [We]874-we ought to double back for a bit , just to make sure [we]874-we ’re not being followed ! ”[218-moody] [Moody]218-moody shouted .

“ ARE [YOU]156-harry MAD , MAD - EYE ? ”[225-tonks] [Tonks]225-tonks screamed from the front . “ [We]874-we ’re all frozen to [our]874-we brooms ! If [we]874-we keep going off course [we]874-we ’re not going to get [there]796-there until next week ! [We]874-we ’re nearly there now ! ”[225-tonks]

“ Time to start the descent ! ”[221-lupin] came [Lupin]221-lupin ’s voice . “ Follow [Tonks]225-tonks , [Harry]156-harry ! ”[221-lupin]

[Harry]156-harry followed [Tonks]225-tonks into a dive . [They]881-they were heading for the largest collection of lights [he]156-harry had yet seen , a huge , sprawling , crisscrossing mass , glittering in lines and grids , interspersed with patches of deepest black . Lower and lower [they]881-they flew , until [Harry]156-harry could see individual headlights and streetlamps , chimneys , and television aerials . [He]156-harry wanted to reach the ground very much , though [he]156-harry felt sure that [someone]571-someone would have to unfreeze [him]156-harry from [his]156-harry broom .

“ Here [we]881-they go ! ”[225-tonks] called [Tonks]225-tonks , and a few seconds later [she]225-tonks had landed .

[Harry]156-harry touched down right behind [her]225-tonks and dismounted on a patch of unkempt grass in [the middle of [a small square]884-a small square]883-the middle of a small square . [Tonks]225-tonks was already unbuckling [Harry]156-harry ’s trunk . [Shivering]240-shivering , [Harry]156-harry looked around . The grimy fronts of [the surrounding houses]885-the surrounding houses were not welcoming ; some of [them]885-the surrounding houses had broken windows , glimmering dully in the light from the streetlamps , paint was peeling from many of the doors , and heaps of rubbish lay outside several sets of front steps .

“ Where are [we]3032-we ? ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry asked , but [Lupin]221-lupin said quietly , “ In a minute . ”[221-lupin]

[Moody]218-moody was rummaging in [his]218-moody cloak , [his]218-moody gnarled hands clumsy with cold .

“ Got it , ”[218-moody] [he]218-moody muttered , raising what looked like a silver cigarette lighter into the air and clicking it .

The nearest streetlamp went out with a pop . [He]218-moody clicked the unlighter again ; the next lamp went out . [He]218-moody kept clicking until every lamp in [the square]886-the square was extinguished and the only light in [the square]886-the square came from curtained windows and the sickle moon overhead .

“ Borrowed it from [Dumbledore]176-dumbledore , ”[218-moody] growled [Moody]218-moody , pocketing the Put - Outer . “ That ’ll take care of any Muggles looking out of the window , see ? Now , come on , quick . ”[218-moody]

[He]218-moody took [Harry]156-harry by the arm and led [him]156-harry from [the patch of grass]888-the patch of grass , across [the road]609-the road , and onto [the pavement]890-the pavement . [Lupin]221-lupin and [Tonks]225-tonks followed , carrying [[Harry]156-harry ’s trunk]891-harry ’s trunk between [them]892-them , the rest of the guard , all with [their]892-them wands out , flanking [them]892-them .

The muffled pounding of a stereo was coming from an upper window in [the nearest house]893-the nearest house . A pungent smell of rotting rubbish came from the pile of bulging bin - bags just inside the broken gate .

“ Here , ”[218-moody] [Moody]218-moody muttered , thrusting a piece of parchment toward [Harry]156-harry ’s Disillusioned hand and holding [his]218-moody lit wand close to it , so as to illuminate the writing . “ Read quickly and memorize . ”[218-moody]

[Harry]156-harry looked down at the piece of paper . The narrow handwriting was vaguely familiar . It said :

[The headquarters of [the Order of the Phoenix]895-the order of the phoenix]894-the headquarters of the order of the phoenix may be found at number twelve , [Grimmauld Place]34-grimmauld place , [London]35-london .

[They]896-the houses were standing outside number eleven ; [he]156-harry looked to the left and saw number ten ; to the right , however , was number thirteen .

“ But where ’s — ? ”[896-the houses]

[Harry]156-harry thought , and no sooner had [he]156-harry reached the part about number twelve , [Grimmauld Place]34-grimmauld place , than a battered door emerged out of nowhere between numbers eleven and thirteen , followed swiftly by dirty walls and grimy windows . “ Get in quick , [Harry]156-harry , ”[221-lupin] [Lupin]221-lupin whispered . “ But do n’t go far inside and do n’t touch anything . ”[221-lupin]

[Harry]156-harry stepped over the threshold into the almost total darkness of [the hall]693-the hall . “ Here — ”[218-moody]

“ SO [YOU]935-you HAVEN’T BEEN IN THE MEETINGS , [BIG DEAL]36-big deal ! [YOU’VE]935-you STILL BEEN HERE , HAVEN’T [YOU]935-you ? Every bitter and resentful thought that [Harry]156-harry had had in the past month was pouring out of [him]156-harry ; [his]156-harry frustration at the lack of news , the hurt that [they]936-we had all been together without [him]156-harry , [his]156-harry fury at being followed and not told about it : All the feelings [he]156-harry was half - ashamed of finally burst [their]936-we boundaries . [Hedwig]213-hedwig took fright at the noise and soared off on top of the wardrobe again ; [Pigwidgeon]243-pigwidgeon twittered in alarm and zoomed even faster around [their]936-we heads .

“ WHO HAD TO GET PAST DRAGONS AND SPHINXES AND EVERY OTHER FOUL THING LAST YEAR ? WHO SAW [HIM]40-the sorcerer ’s stone COME BACK ? WHO HAD TO ESCAPE FROM [HIM]40-the sorcerer ’s stone ? [ME]243-pigwidgeon ! ”[243-pigwidgeon]

[Ron]333-ron was standing there with [his]333-ron mouth half - open , clearly stunned and at a loss for anything to say , while [Hermione]172-hermione looked on the verge of tears .

“ Had a good summer so far ? ”[174-sirius]

“ Do n’t know what [you]156-harry ’re complaining about , [myself]174-sirius . ”[174-sirius]

“ What ? ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry incredulously .

“ Personally , [I]174-sirius ’d have welcomed a dementor attack . A deadly struggle for [my]174-sirius soul would have broken the monotony nicely . [You]156-harry think [you]156-harry ’ve had it bad , at least [you]156-harry ’ve been able to get out and about , stretch [your]156-harry legs , get into a few fights ... [I]174-sirius ’ve been stuck inside for a month . ”[174-sirius]

“ How come ? ”[156-harry] asked [Harry]156-harry , frowning .

“ Because [the Ministry of Magic]2890-the ministry of magic ’s still after [me]174-sirius , and [Voldemort]170-voldemort will know all about [me]174-sirius being [an Animagus]3173-an animagus by now , [Wormtail]267-wormtail will have told [him]170-voldemort , so [my]174-sirius big disguise is useless . There was something about the slightly flattened tone of voice in which [Sirius]174-sirius uttered [Dumbledore]176-dumbledore ’s name that told [Harry]156-harry that [Sirius]174-sirius was not very happy with [the headmaster]1012-the headmaster either . [Fred]244-fred and [George]245-george had bewitched a large cauldron of stew , an iron flagon of butterbeer , and a heavy wooden breadboard , complete with knife , to hurtle through the air toward [them]1015-them . [Harry]156-harry and [Sirius]174-sirius were both laughing . [Sirius]174-sirius started to rise from [his]174-sirius chair .

“ [WE]917-all of them ARE NOT RUNNING A HIDEOUT FOR STOLEN GOODS ! ”[242-mrs. weasley]

“ [I]244-fred love hearing [Mum]188-mum shouting at [someone else]3333-someone else , ”[244-fred] said [Fred]244-fred , with a satisfied smile on [his]244-fred face as [he]244-fred opened the door an inch or so to allow [Mrs. Weasley]242-mrs. weasley ’s voice to permeate [the room]707-the room better . “ It makes such a nice change . ”[242-mrs. weasley]

“ — COMPLETELY IRRESPONSIBLE , AS IF [WE]917-all of them HAVEN’T GOT ENOUGH TO WORRY ABOUT WITHOUT [YOU]245-george DRAGGING [STOLEN CAULDRONS]55-stolen cauldrons INTO [THE HOUSE]2870-the house — ”[244-fred]

[Mrs. Weasley]242-mrs. weasley ’s voice was lost amid fresh shrieks and screams from the portraits in [the hall]693-the hall . [George]245-george made to shut the door to drown the noise , but before [he]244-fred could do so , [a house - elf]1096-a house - elf edged into [the room]707-the room .

Except for the filthy rag tied like a loincloth around [its]1096-a house - elf middle , it was completely naked . [It]1096-a house - elf looked very old . [Its]1096-a house - elf skin seemed to be several times too big for [it]1096-a house - elf and though it was bald like [all house - elves]1098-all house - elves , there was a quantity of white hair growing out of [its]1096-a house - elf large , batlike ears . [Its]1096-a house - elf eyes were a bloodshot and watery gray , and its fleshy nose was large and rather snoutlike .

[The elf]1099-the elf took absolutely no notice of [Harry]156-harry and [the rest]1100-the rest . The tapestry looked immensely old ; it was faded and looked as though [doxies]1117-doxies had gnawed it in places ; nevertheless , the golden thread with which it was embroidered still glinted brightly enough to show [them]615-the others a sprawling family tree dating back to the Middle Ages .

“ [You]174-sirius ’re not on [here]524-here ! ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry , after scanning the bottom of the tree .

“ [You]3431-you ’re related to [the Malfoys]299-the malfoys ! ”[294-andromeda]

“ [The pure - blood families]3432-the pure - blood families are all interrelated , ”[174-sirius] said [Sirius]174-sirius . “ If [you]3431-you ’re only going to let [[your]3431-you sons]3433-your sons and [daughters]3434-daughters marry [purebloods]3435-purebloods [your]3431-you choice is very limited , there are hardly any of [us]3436-us left . But [Harry]156-harry was now looking at the name to the left of [Andromeda]294-andromeda ’s burn : [Bellatrix Black]295-bellatrix , which was connected by a double line to [Rodolphus Lestrange]300-rodolphus .

“ Lestrange ... ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry said aloud . “ [They]3439-them ’re in [Azkaban]14-azkaban , ”[174-sirius] said [Sirius]174-sirius shortly .

[Harry]156-harry looked at [him]174-sirius curiously .

“ [Bellatrix]295-bellatrix and [[her]295-bellatrix husband]1006-her husband [Rodolphus]300-rodolphus came in with [Barty Crouch]301-barty crouch , [Junior]302-junior , ”[174-sirius] said [Sirius]174-sirius in the same brusque voice . “ [[Rodolphus]300-rodolphus ’s brother]3443-rodolphus ’s brother , [Rabastan]303-rabastan , was with [them]3444-them too . ”[174-sirius]

And [Harry]156-harry remembered : [He]156-harry had seen [Bellatrix Lestrange]304-bellatrix lestrange inside [[Dumbledore]176-dumbledore ’s Pensieve]1120-dumbledore ’s pensieve , the strange device in which thoughts and memories could be stored : [a tall dark woman with heavy - “ Sorry , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry quickly , “ [I]156-harry did n’t mean — [I]156-harry was just surprised , that ’s all — ”[156-harry]

“ It does n’t matter , do n’t apologize , ”[174-sirius] [Sirius]174-sirius mumbled at once . [He]174-sirius turned away from the tapestry , [his]174-sirius hands deep in [his]174-sirius pockets . “ [I]174-sirius do n’t like being back here , ”[174-sirius] [he]174-sirius said , staring across [the drawing room]3075-the drawing room . “ [I]174-sirius never thought [I]174-sirius ’d be stuck in [this house]2943-this house again . ”[174-sirius]

[Harry]156-harry understood completely . [He]174-sirius knew how [he]174-sirius would feel if forced , when [he]174-sirius was grown up and thought [he]174-sirius was free of [the place]2945-the place forever , to return and live at number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive .

“ [It]2945-the place ’s ideal for [headquarters]2989-headquarters , of course , ”[174-sirius] [Sirius]174-sirius said . “ [[My]174-sirius father]3453-my father put every security measure known to Wizard - kind on it when [he]3453-my father lived [here]524-here . [He]174-sirius scowled for a moment , then sighed .

“ [I]174-sirius would n’t mind if [I]174-sirius could just get out occasionally and do something useful . [I]174-sirius ’ve asked [Dumbledore]176-dumbledore whether [I]174-sirius can escort [you]3455-you to [your]3455-you hearing — as Snuffles , obviously — so [I]174-sirius can give [you]3455-you a bit of moral support , what [d’you]3455-you think ? ”[174-sirius]

[Harry]156-harry felt as though [his]156-harry stomach had sunk through the dusty carpet . [He]156-harry had not thought about the hearing once since dinner the previous evening ; in the excitement of being back with [the people [he]156-harry liked best]1124-the people he liked best , of hearing everything that was going on , it had completely flown [his]156-harry mind . At [Sirius]174-sirius ’s words , however , the crushing sense of dread returned to [him]156-harry . [He]156-harry stared at [Hermione]172-hermione and [the Weasleys]254-the weasleys , all tucking into [their]1125-they sandwiches , and thought how [he]156-harry would feel if [they]1125-they went back to [Hogwarts]13-hogwarts without [him]156-harry .

“ Do n’t worry , ”[174-sirius] [Sirius]174-sirius said . [Harry]156-harry looked up and realized that [Sirius]174-sirius had been watching [him]156-harry . “ [I]174-sirius ’m sure [they]1125-they ’re going to clear [you]156-harry , there ’s definitely something in the International Statute of Secrecy about being allowed to use magic to save [your]156-harry own life . ”[174-sirius]

“ But if [they]1125-they do expel [me]156-harry , ”[156-harry] said [Harry]156-harry , quietly , “ can [I]156-harry come back here and live with [you]174-sirius ? ”[156-harry]

[Sirius]174-sirius smiled sadly .

“ [We]3462-we ’ll see . ”[174-sirius]

“ [I]156-harry ’d feel a lot better about the hearing if [I]156-harry knew [I]156-harry did n’t have to go back to [the Dursleys]161-the dursleys , ”[156-harry] [Harry]156-harry pressed [him]174-sirius .
